bugs.title: CVE-2015-4551 libreoffice: Arbitrary file disclosure in Calc and Writer [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-4551 libreoffice: Arbitrary file disclosure in Calc and Writer [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-4551 libreoffice: Arbitrary file disclosure in Calc and Writer

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability in OpenOffice and LibreOffice settings of OpenDocument Format files and templates, allowing silent access to files that are readable from an user account, over-riding the user's default configuration settings, was found. Once these files are imported into a maliciously-crafted document, the data can be silently hidden in the document and possibly exported to an external party without being observed. 

Versions affected by this vulnerability are LibreOffice < 4.4.5 and OpenOffice <= 4.1.1.

External reference:

http://www.libreoffice.org/about-us/security/advisories/cve-2015-4551/
http://www.openoffice.org/security/cves/CVE-2015-4551.html

Created libreoffice tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1278813]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2015:2619 https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-2619.html

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure

of Fedora.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

up to date f22 is unaffected, f20 is eol, so only f21 affected
libreoffice-4.3.7.2-13.fc21 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 21. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2015-f92fd549f1

libreoffice-4.3.7.2-13.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
If you want to test the update, you can install it with
$ su -c 'dnf --enablerepo=updates-testing update libreoffice'
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2015-f92fd549f1

bugs.title: CVE-2015-5212 libreoffice: Integer underflow in PrinterSetup length [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-5212 libreoffice: Integer underflow in PrinterSetup length [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-5212 libreoffice: Integer underflow in PrinterSetup length

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that crafted ODF document can be used to create a buffer that is too small for the amount of data loaded into it, allowing an attacker to cause denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) and possible execution of arbitrary code.

Products affected are LibreOffice < 4.4.5 and OpenOffice <= 4.1.1.

External reference:

http://www.libreoffice.org/about-us/security/advisories/cve-2015-5212/
http://www.openoffice.org/security/cves/CVE-2015-5212.html

Created libreoffice tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1278821]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2015:2619 https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-2619.html

bugs.title: CVE-2015-5213 libreoffice: Integer overflow in DOC files [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-5213 libreoffice: Integer overflow in DOC files [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-5213 libreoffice: Integer overflow in DOC files

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that crafted Microsoft Word DOC file can be used to specify a document buffer that is too small for the amount of data provided for it. Failure to detect the discrepancy allows an attacker to cause denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) and possible execution of arbitrary code.

Products affected are LibreOffice < 4.4.5 and OpenOffice <= 4.1.1.

External reference:

http://www.libreoffice.org/about-us/security/advisories/cve-2015-5213/
http://www.openoffice.org/security/cves/CVE-2015-5213.html

Created libreoffice tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1278825]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2015:2619 https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-2619.html

bugs.title: CVE-2015-5214 libreoffice: Bookmarks in DOC documents are insufficiently checked causing memory corruption [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-5214 libreoffice: Bookmarks in DOC documents are insufficiently checked causing memory corruption [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-5214 libreoffice: Bookmarks in DOC documents are insufficiently checked causing memory corruption

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that indexes into the bookmark array were insufficiently checked for validity. A document can be constructed which refers to bookmarks that don't exist, causing memory corruption.

Products affected are LibreOffice < 4.4.6 and OpenOffice <= 4.1.1.

External reference:

http://www.libreoffice.org/about-us/security/advisories/cve-2015-5214/
http://www.openoffice.org/security/cves/CVE-2015-5214.html

Created libreoffice tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1278829]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2015:2619 https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-2619.html

bug.title: CVE-2015-5214 libreoffice: Bookmarks in DOC documents are insufficiently checked causing memory corruption [fedora-all]
CVE-2015-5213 libreoffice: Integer overflow in DOC files [fedora-all]
CVE-2015-5212 libreoffice: Integer underflow in PrinterSetup length [fedora-all]
CVE-2015-4551 libreoffice: Arbitrary file disclosure in Calc and Writer [fedora-all]

notes:
libreoffice-4.3.7.2-13.fc21

- Resolves: rhbz#1278813 CVE-2015-4551
- Resolves: rhbz#1278821 CVE-2015-5212
- Resolves: rhbz#1278825 CVE-2015-5213
- Resolves: rhbz#1278829 CVE-2015-5214
- fix IterateMatrix for ifPRODUCT and ifSUMSQ
- use exponential 'E' format for General when appropriate
- Resolves: tdf#94173: Calc doesn't save your own created autoformat presets
- fix ODF import of gradient draw:angle attribute a bit
- Resolves: tdf#94804: Writer prefix of cross reference bookmark fixed
title: libreoffice-4.3.7.2-13.fc21
